pullRequest.body:
This PR includes some equalities and equivalences about expressions in euclidean domains.

They can be useful as rewriting lemmas to simplify expressions.

---

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [d7ef132069](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/23076/commits/d7ef132069238972f5dd2d4801890f3f0cd304b7)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ add_mul_div_left`
`+ add_mul_div_right`
`+ div_add_div_of_dvd`
`+ div_div`
`+ div_eq_div_iff_mul_eq_mul_of_dvd`
`+ div_eq_iff_eq_mul_of_dvd`
`+ div_mul`
`+ div_sub_div_of_dvd`
`+ eq_div_iff_mul_eq_of_dvd`
`+ mul_add_div_left`
`+ mul_add_div_right`
`+ mul_sub_div_left`
`+ mul_sub_div_right`
`+ sub_mul_div_left`
`+ sub_mul_div_right`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Please adjust the PR title to follow the convention, which should be in the contribution guide.
I also made variables explicit in the cases where they are not all used in the hypothesis.
Added a proof that handles the cases with zero denominators.
This may be true in the case that `y = 0` or `z = 0`?

you are right.

good catch.

Why not one line?
```suggestion
  rw [mul_add, EuclideanDomain.mul_div_cancel' h1 h2]
```

```suggestion
theorem div_div {x y z : R} (h1 : y ∣ x) (h2 : z ∣ (x / y)) :
```

```suggestion
    (h3 : y ∣ x) (h4 : t ∣ z) : x / y = z / t ↔ t * x = y * z := by
```

Another option is to split this into two lemmas:
```
theorem div_mul {x y z : R} (h1 : y ∣ x) (h2 : y * z ∣ x) :
    x / (y * z) = x / y / z := by
  rcases eq_or_ne z 0 with rfl | hz
  · simp
  apply eq_div_of_mul_eq_right hz
  rw [← EuclideanDomain.mul_div_assoc z h2, mul_comm y z, mul_div_mul_cancel hz h1]

theorem div_div {x y z : R} (h1 : y ∣ x) (h2 : z ∣ (x / y)) :
    x / y / z = x / (y * z) := by
  rcases eq_or_ne y 0 with rfl | hy
  · simp
  rw [← mul_dvd_mul_iff_left hy, EuclideanDomain.mul_div_cancel' hy h1] at h2
  exact (div_mul h1 h2).symm
```
Nice!

```suggestion
  apply eq_div_of_mul_eq_right (mul_ne_zero h2 h1)
  rw [mul_add, mul_assoc, EuclideanDomain.mul_div_cancel' h1 h3, mul_comm t y,
    mul_assoc, EuclideanDomain.mul_div_cancel' h2 h4]
```

```suggestion
  apply eq_div_of_mul_eq_right (mul_ne_zero h2 h1)
  rw [mul_sub, mul_assoc, EuclideanDomain.mul_div_cancel' h1 h3, mul_comm t y,
    mul_assoc, EuclideanDomain.mul_div_cancel' h2 h4]
```

There should be spaces after commas here and elsewhere.
```suggestion
  rw [ha, mul_div_cancel_left₀ _ h1]
```
I added them.

```suggestion
    x = y / z ↔ z * x = y := by
```

```suggestion
    x / y = z ↔ x = y * z := by
```
Why not one line?
Why indent here?

You mean in the `obtain`block?

I did it because it is a secondary goal that was inserted as a requirement for `eq_div_iff_mul_eq_of_dvd _ _ _ h2` 
(it is the last implicit hypothesis there).

Should we not indent if the main goal is closed and we have only one secondary goal left?
Yeah, I think usually we only indent when there is more than one goal.
Ok, changed.

For `Int` and `Nat` this is called [`add_mul_div_left`](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Init/Data/Nat/Div/Basic.html#Nat.add_mul_div_left) and stated in reverse. Can you [use loogle](https://loogle.lean-lang.org/?q=%28%3Fx+%2B+%3Fy+*+%3Fz%29+%2F+%3Fy+%3D+%3Fx+%2F+%3Fy+%2B+%3Fz) to search for all of these (and their reverses, and then match the names to the Int/Nat ones?
I did change the names of the ones I did find. I also added the `_right` versions.

pullRequest.title: feat: add rewriting lemmas for euclidean domains

nodes.body: Please adjust the PR title to follow the convention, which should be in the contribution guide.
Added a proof that handles the cases with zero denominators.
I also made variables explicit in the cases where they are not all used in the hypothesis.
